analysis.Summary: Vue 3 sidebar component for the Backoffice area, rendering two sets of navigation items (menuItems and generalItems) with icons and click behavior to navigate via vue-router.
analysis.Purpose: Provides a scrollable, fixed sidebar navigation panel in the Backoffice section of the application, allowing users to switch between different views (Organizations, Community, Products, etc.).

Components.name: SelectMulti
Components.responsibility: Imported but not currently used: intended for multi-select UI in mobile contexts.

Components.name: IconGroups
Components.responsibility: Visual icon for the "Organizations" menu item.

Components.name: IconCommunity
Components.responsibility: Visual icon for the "Community" menu item.

Components.name: IconProducts
Components.responsibility: Visual icon for the "Products" menu item.

Components.name: IconLeftovers
Components.responsibility: Visual icon for the "Leftovers" menu item.

Components.name: IconOrders
Components.responsibility: Visual icon for the "Orders" menu item.

Components.name: IconGallery
Components.responsibility: Visual icon for the "Gallery" menu item.

Components.name: IconEvents
Components.responsibility: Visual icon for the "Events" menu item.

Components.name: IconPayments
Components.responsibility: Visual icon for the "Payments" general item.

Functions.name: onMounted
Functions.description: Vue lifecycle hook invoked when component is mounted. Currently defined as an async stub with no operations.

Functions.name: router.push
Functions.description: Invoked on click of each menu/general item to perform programmatic navigation to the named route.

analysis.Usage: Imported into a Backoffice layout or parent component to render the sidebar; other components do not directly import it but rely on its router navigation for view switching.
Notes: Props.favorites is defined but not utilized in the template or script logic.
The sidebar style block is empty; styling is inherited from global utility classes (e.g., flex, pd-semi).
menuItems and generalItems are static arrays; dynamic control (e.g., permissions filtering) would need to be added if required.
Icons are rendered with <component :is="..."> to allow conditional inclusion and consistent styling.
No error handling or loading state is implemented in onMounted â€“ currently a placeholder.
